en: Then he cried in mine ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause ye them that have charge over the city to draw near, every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.
hmr: Chun, râwl inringtakin ka naa chun a hung khêk a, “Mi tinin mâni suksietna hriemhrei a kuta chawiin, khawpui enkawltuhai chu hung inhnaitir rawh,” a ta.

en: And behold, six men came from the way of the upper gate, which lieth toward the north, every man with his slaughter weapon in his hand; and one man in the midst of them clothed in linen, with a writer’s inkhorn by his side. And they went in, and stood beside the brazen altar.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, hmârtienga um, dâi kawtkhâr chunghnung lema chun mi paruk, mi tinin mâni sukhlumna hriemhrei chu kuta chawiin an hung a; anni laia pakhat chu puon zai inhmiin ân chei a, a kâwngah lekhaziektu lekhatui bûr a pai a. Chun, anni chu an va lût a, dârsen mâichâm bula chun an ngîr tah a.

en: And the glory of the God of Israel was gone up from the cherub, whereupon it was, to the threshold of the house: and he called to the man clothed in linen, who had the writer’s inkhorn by his side.
hmr: Chun, Israel Pathien ropuina chu, a umna hmuna inthawk chun in kawtkhâr bula chun a hang feh a; chun, mi puon zai inhmia inchei a, a kâwnga lekhaziektu lekhatuibûr neitu chu a ko tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry over all the abominations that are done in the midst thereof.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun a kuoma chun, “Khawpui laia chun, Jerusalem laia chun fe suok la, chu sûnga tirdak- umnahai thawa um tahai po po leia khêk a, thuokdawnghai mi chuonghai bâwkhaia chun inchikna sie rawh,” a tih a.

en: And to the others he said in my hearing, Go ye through the city after him, and smite: let not your eye spare, neither have ye pity;
hmr: Chun, mi dang kuoma khawm keia hrieta chun, “Ama hnunga chun khawpui chu va fang la, va sukhlum rawh; i mitin hla naw sienla, lungin- sietna nei bawk naw rawh;

en: slay utterly the old man, the young man and the virgin, and little children and women; but come not near any man upon whom is the mark: and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the old men that were before the house.
hmr: putarhai, tlangvâlhai, nunghâk- hai, naupangtêhai, nuhmeihai chu that fairêt rawh; amiruokchu, mi a chunga inchikna um chu hung hnai naw la; chun, ka hmun inthienga chun ṭan rawh,” tiin. Chun, biekin tuola um mi upahaia chun an ṭan tah a.

en: And he said unto them, Defile the house, and fill the courts with the slain: go ye forth. And they went forth, and smote in the city.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun, “In chu sukpawrche unla, tuollaihai chu mi thathai chun suksip ro; fe ro le,” a ta, chun, an fe suok a, khawpuia chun an that tah a.

en: And it came to pass, while they were smiting, and I was left, that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord Jehovah! wilt thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy wrath upon Jerusalem?
hmr: Chun, an that zing lai chun keia khâta mâksanin ka um a, ka hmaia hnuoi sikin ka bawkkhup a, ka khêk a, “A, Lalpa PATHIEN! Jerusalem chunga i lunginsenna i bunthlâka hin Israel la um sunhai po po chu i suk- bohmang vawng ding am a nih?” ka tih a.

en: Then said he unto me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceeding great, and the land is full of blood, and the city full of wresting of judgment: for they say, Jehovah hath forsaken the land, and Jehovah seeth not.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Juda le Israel sûngkaw suolna chu a nasa êm êm a, ram chu thisenin a sip a, khawpui sûng chu rorêlna pawisak nawnain a sip a, ‘LALPA chun ram hi a nghatsan tah a, LALPA chun a hmu nawh,’ an ti sih a.

en: And as for me also, mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity, but I will bring their way upon their head.
hmr: Chuongchun, keia ta ding khawma, ka mitin hla naw nih a, lunginsietna nei bawk naw ning, ami- ruokchu, an suol man chu an lu chungah innghat lem ka tih,” a ta.

en: And, behold, the man clothed in linen, who had the inkhorn by his side, reported the matter, saying, I have done as thou hast commanded me.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, mi puon zai in- hmia inchei a, a kâwnga lekhatuibûr neitu khan thu chu a hung hrilsâwng a, “Nangin thu i mi pêk ang tak khan ka thaw tah,” tiin.
